thread.title: Fairhaven clinches its 15th straight postseason berth
thread.title_full: Fairhaven clinches its 15th straight postseason berth

author: Staff Reports sports@s-t.com
title: Fairhaven clinches its 15th straight postseason berth
text: Posted Oct. 5, 2015 at 9:18 PM By Staff Reports Posted Oct. 5, 2015 at 9:18 PM » Social News Karen Arsenault has been the Fairhaven volleyball coach for 15 years and her girls defeated Seekonk, 3-1, Monday night and qualified for the MIAA South Sectional tournament for the 15th straight year in the process. The Blue Devils improved to 11-1 overall and 8-1 in the South Coast Conference, winning the match by scores of 25-12, 14-25, 25-12, 25-21. Senior setter Stormie Becotte handed out 32 assists and served four aces, had 10 digs and six kills to lead Fairhaven. Junior Alexis Duarte added 12 kills, two aces and 16 digs; senior Kacey McKenna had seven kills and two aces, and sophomore Lexi Teves added five assists. Fairhaven will be home against Old Rochester on Wednesday. Apponequet 3, Wareham 1 After dropping the first set 22-25, the Lakers came to life and won the next three sets, 25-11, 25-17 and 25-11. … Senior Shawna Walker had 22 service points and six aces, five kills and 13 assists and Shaye Stanley added seven kills and 10 digs for Apponequet (4-7, 2-7 South Coast Conference). … The Lakers are home Wednesday against GNB Voc-Tech. New Bedford 3, Bishop Stang 0 Behind a strong all-around game from Elyssa Johnson, the Whalers earned the sweep, winning 25-14, 25-20, 25-16. … Johnson finished 16-for-18 hitting with 12 kills, five aces and 16 service points. … For New Bedford, Jianna Heydt was 27-for-30 hitting with 15 kills, Kalyn Mello had 20 assists and Amy DeSousa was 10-for-10 passing with 13 digs. Defensively, Makenzie Smith and Leira Vazquez anchored the back line. … Stang was led by Lauren Jackson, who had five aces and four kills, and Mackenezie Shurtleff with two kills and one ace. … New Bedford (5-4, 1-1 Big 3) plays at Taunton on Wednesday, while the Spartans (2-9, 0-2 EAC) are at Coyle-Cassidy on Thursday. Old Colony 3, Avon 0 Anne Harrison played well at the net, slamming down 12 kills. … Cydney Girard finished with 16 service points and Jasmyn Andrade was a force defensively. … Game scores were 25-16, 25-20, 25-15. … The Cougars (5-4, 2-2 Mayflower Small) play at Norfolk Aggie today. GNB Voc-Tech 3, Diman Voke 0 The Bears cruised to victory, playing everyone and winning 25-9, 25-10, 25-9. … Sommer Cardoso had five aces among 12 service points and Alexis Teves had five aces among 14 service points. … GNB Voc-Tech (8-4, 6-3 SCC) goes on the road to face Apponequet on Wednesday. FIELD HOCKEY Apponequet 2, Dighton-Rehoboth 1 The Lakers came back from a 1-0 deficit in the final three minutes, scoring twice to send D-R to its first defeat and allowing Apponequet to climb into a first-place tie with the Falcons in the South Coast Conference. …Senior Hannah Chapman tied the match with her goal with 2:47 to play on an assist from Colette Macuch. … Chapman then scored the winning goal with 47 seconds to play, assisted by Caitlin Baril. …“In all my years of coaching, this was my most amazing comeback,” Apponequet coach Cindy Cuthbertson said. … D-R scored on a penalty corner by Erin Kelly after time had expired in the first half. … Sophomore Katie Little had five saves for the Lakers. … Both teams are 6-1 in the South Coast Conference at the halfway point in the season. Old Rochester 2, New Bedford 1 The Bulldogs went with a faster lineup and it surprised the Whalers. “We came out speedy,” ORR coach Polly Lawrence said. “We played well in the second half. The speed was definitely a factor today.”… Morgan Middleton scored both goals for ORR, with an assist from Sophia Church. … New Bedford’s goal came from Riley Indio. … Riley Goulart and Gates Tenerowicz split time in goal for ORR. … The Bulldogs (4-4-1, 3-2-1 SCC) host Falmouth today. The Whalers (4-3-2) host Taunton on Wednesday. Fairhaven 5, Wareham 0 Brooke Douglas scored three goals — two in the first half — to lead the Blue Devils to their second win of the season. … Hannah Nordstrom scored twice and Morgan DaSilva, Ashley Rice and Bethany Ramos added assists. …“Everyone was having a particularly good day today,” coach Kacie Sturgeon said. “It was nice to see them playing like I know they can play.”… Audrey Simmons made one save. … The Blue Devils (2-7, 2-6 SCC) host Old Rochester on Wednesday. GOLF Fairhaven 111, New Bedford 83 Senior Justin Bennett fired a 1-under-par 35 at the Whaling City Golf Course for New Bedford High and scored 28 points in the modified Stableford scoring system. … Hunter Lees led the Fairhaven team with a 37 (26 points), followed by Craig Demers (39, 24 points), Ryan McKenna (44, 19), Brett Enos (45, 18), Corey Bergeron (46, 17) and Seth Medeiros (56, 7). … Other scorers for New Bedford (2-10, 1-3 Big 3) were Logan Heydt (44, 19), Conner Roy (48, 15), Zach Medeiros (54, 9), Gavin Parent (55, 8) and Alex Andrade (59, 7). … Bennet’s season average dropped to 36.75 over 12 matches. Blue Hills 9, Westport 0 The Wildcats (0-9) were shut out by Blue Hills Regional in a non-league match between Mayflower League teams at the par-35 Acoaxet Golf Club. … Westport will play a league match against Diman Voke this afternoon at Swansea Country Club. By Staff Reports
